defs: the skin of common iguana (Iguana tuberculata), either tanned or raw.
a string of cotton or metal tied round the waist.
a metal belt-like ornament for the waist (worn by women).
the Moon, as the lord of the stars.
= ಉಡುದೇವ.
a man having disabled or under-developed legs and arms; a cripple.
= ಉಡುದೇವ.
a flat structure of fastened bamboos, logs, etc. used to move on a water body; a raft.
a snake.
the bird Cuculus melanoleucus, fabled to live only upon rain drops.
Varuna, the Lord of Oceans.
a surname used by a sect of brāhmaṇas in the western districts of Karnāṭaka.
a phase of the moon, when it appears to have one concave edge and one convex edge; the crescent moon.
Śiva, who has the crescent moon in his crest.
= ಉಡುದೇವ.
Śiva, who has the moon in his crest.

Budha, a planet in the Solar system, mythologically considered to be the son of Moon; (Budha is one of the nine planets which are considered in astrology as influencing human life, based on their position at the time the birth).
the sky as the path for stars movement.
a woman whose face shines like the full moon; a comely woman.
cloth, clothing or apparel worn to cover the body; a dress.
a person who makes, repairs or alters clothes; a tailor.
(pl.) dress and ornaments.
an animal akin to squirrel.
a small pond or lake.
= ಉಡುಪಥ.
a face as delicate and comely as the flower of the tree Indian walnut tree (Albizzia lebbeck).
= ಉಡುದೇವ.
Śiva, who has the moon in his crest.
= ಉಡುಪಮುಖಿ.
the short, deep, hoarse and reverberating, roar of a bull; bellow; grunt.
to roar with a powerful, reverberating sound, as a bull; (a bull) to bellow.
the Moon, as the lord of the stars.
something that is presented to show friendship, affection, support, etc.; a gift; a present.
cloth, clothing or apparel worn to cover the body; a dress.
the plant Canscora decussata of Gentianceae family; (?).
a place, relatively vast expanse of land, covered or overgrown with bushes.
an animal akin to squirrel.
a washing of the floor of a house with the mixture of cow dung and water.
a long unsewn cloth worn by women round the waist, one end of which covers the upper portion also; a sari.
the moon, as the lord of the stars.
a man deprived of natural physical ability; a disabled man.
to break into pieces; to separate two or more words that make a conjugated or compound word; to disintegrate.
the part of the humanbody between the ribs and the hips; the waist.
the part of a garment that covers the waist.
a pouch made in front by women by folding or doubling a part of their sari, (the loose, long cloth worn round the waist loosely covering the chest and one shoulder also), to hold something.
cloth, clothing or apparel worn to cover the body; a dress; an apparel.
a lord; a king; an owner; a master.
an ornamental bell tied to the waist of a child.
a string of cotton or metal tied round the waist.
a belt-like metal ornament for the waist (worn by women).
an animal's tanned skin used as a cloth for covering the portion below the navel (usu. upto the knees).
= ಉಡೆದೊವಲ್.
the fold of a sari (of a woman) in front.
= ಉಡೆನೂಲು.
= ಉಡೆದಾರ.
= ಉಡೆದಾರ.
a string with a small ornamental bell tied to the waist of a child.
a lord; a king; an owner; a master.
to remove (the clothing) of (a person); to make naked; to undress.
= ಉಡೆಮಣಿ.
to tie an ಉಡೆವಣಿto the waist.
to untie an ಉಡೆವಣಿ that is tied to the waist.
to tie a dhoti or a sari round the waist.
one without (proper) dress to wear.
the act, manner or power of flying or moving through space; a flight.
the act or process of launching a spacecraft, plane, etc.; a launch.
a trip by a spacecraft or airplane.
to roll (an object) back and forth or all over on the ground.
to roll (oneself) back and forth or all over on the ground.
the fact, act or an instance of moving in the sky; a space-journey.
to move, fly in the sky; to jump into the space above.
to make a journey in the sky.
a heap or pile, esp. the one in which three things are kept closely in the shape of a triangle shape and another kept above them.
the tree Dolichandrone falcata of Bignoniaceae family.
(dial.) the act of colliding or coming together with sudden, violent force; collision.
the nut of areca tree, Areca catechu of Arecaceae family.
a small heap of three seeds of Indian filbert (Caesalpinia bonducell or C. bonduc) kept closely in the shape of a triangle and an other kept above them.
= ಉಡ್ಡಿಯಾಣಬಂಧ.
one of the three process of self-control in haṭha yōga ( a mode of abstract contemplation, forcing the mind to abstain from external objects).
a jumping up; the act of projecting or propelling (an object or oneself) into the space above.
flying or moving in the sky.
a soaring or flying up; a space journey.
one of the eight kinds of flight of birds.
to confront or act in opposition; to oppose.
= ಉಡ್ಡಾಣ.
the magical art of moving in the sky (without using any external means).
= ಉಡ್ಡಾಣ.
= ಉಣ್ಣು.

ಉಣನೀಡು uṇanīḍu to offer food; to serve a meal; ಉಣಬಡಿಸು uṇabaḍisu = ಉಣನೀಡು; ಉಣಬರು uṇabaru to come for having a meal; ಉಣಲಿಕ್ಕಿಸು uṇalikkisu to cause to serve food; ಉಣಲಿಕ್ಕು uṇalikku = ಉಣನೀಡು; ಉಣಲಿಡು uṇaliḍu = ಉಣನೀಡು; ಉಣಲುಳ್ಳಂ uṇaluḷḷan he who has (sufficient) resouses for his living; ಉಣಲ್ಕೀ uṇalkī = ಉಣನೀಡು; ಉಣಲ್ಪಡೆ uṇalpaḍe to be lucky to get one's meal; ಉಣವೇಳ್ಕುಂ uṇavēḷkum (one) has to have his food 2. to accept the consequences of one's actions (whether pleasant or not); ಉಣಿಯೆಕೊಡು uṇiyekoḍu to let another have food or enjoy the benefits of one's action.
any of small, usu. gregarious toothed whales of the Phocoenidae family, found in most seas, with a torpedo-shaped body and a blunt snout; a porpoise.
the spike of the ear of a plant (as rāgi, jowar etc.).
(dial.) that which is fed as food, esp. the coarse food for cattle, horse, sheep, etc.; fodder.
the plant Uvaria narum of Annonaceae family; biserrate nutmeg.
the act or an instance of having one's meal; taking a meal.
to cause to take a meal; to make one eat.
to cause to suck at the breast or udder; to nurse; to suckle.
to cause or help another, enjoy the fruits of the effort.
a thing fit to be eaten; any eatable.
= ಉಣ್ಣು.
= ಉಣುಗು.

any of tiny, sometimes microscopic, arachnids of the subclass of Acari, often parasitic upon animals, insects or plants or infesting prepared foods, including many species that transmit diseases; mite.
= ಉಣುಗೋಲು.
a round stick or a bamboo that can move in the hole made in a wooden plank or beam.
a room where meals are eaten; a dining room.
a minus sign ' - ' that indicates subtraction; a sign preceding a negative figure.
a person who greedily eats too much or very frequently; a glutton.
to cause another miss his food.
to abstain from taking food.
a defectless thing; that which is free from any fault, flaw or blemish; a perfect thing.
the quality of being big, large or great.
any of a super family (Ixodoidea order Parasitiformes) of wingless, bloodsucking mites, and is parasitic on cattle; a cattle-tick.
a bushy, hedge plant Lantana indica of Verbenaceae family; Indian lantana.
to put (food) in the mouth, chew if necessary, and swallow; to eat; to have a meal.
to take (liquid) into the mouth and swallow it.
to have the use or benefit of; have as one's lot or advantage; to enjoy.

ಉಣ್ಣದರ್ (ಉಣ್ಣದವರು) uṇṇadar (uṇṇadavaru) (pl.) those who live without food; gods; ಉಣ್ಣಕ್ಕಿಲ್ಲದವನು ಬಣ್ಣ ಬಯಸಿದ uṇṇakkilladavanu baṇṇa bayasida (prov.) ask for luxuries when you do not have have even basic necessities like food; (like) starving woman wanting lipstick (instead of a loaf of bread); ಉಣ್ಣದರ ಬೀಯ uṇṇadara bīya (myth.) the food of the gods; ambrosia; ಉಣ್ಣದೂರು uṇṇadūru the city of gods; the heaven; ಉಂಡು ಉಪವಾಸಿ, ಬಳಸಿ ಬ್ರಹ್ಮಚಾರಿ uṇḍu upavāsi, baḷasi brahmacāri (pov .) the innate nature of a person engaged in carnal pleasures, but not influenced by such pleasures; ಉಂಡು ಹೋಗೋ ಮೂಳ ಎಂದರೆ, ಯಾರ ಮನೆ ಜೋಳ ಅಂದ uṇḍu hōgō mūḷa andare, yāra mane jōḷa anda (pov .) to find fault in something which is given as a charity (esp. in a difficult situation); ಉಂಡೂ ಹೋದ, ಕೊಂಡೂ ಹೋದ uṇḍū hōda, koṇḍū hōda (prov.) take all the advantages (often unbecomingly) from a host; ಉಂಡದ್ದೇ ಯುಗಾದಿ, ಮಿಂದದ್ದೇ ದೀವಳಿಗೆ uṇḍaddē yugādi, mindaddē dīvaḷige (prov.) (a consolation of the poor) festival day is the day one is cheerful and happy; ಉಂಡಮನೆ ಗಳವನ್ನು ಎಣಿಸು uṇḍa mane gaḷavannu eṇisu (prov.) = ಉಂಡ ಮನೆಗೆ ಎರಡು ಬಗೆ; ಉಂಡಮನೆಗೆ ಎರಡು ಬಗೆ uṇḍa manege eraḍu bage (prov.) to be ungrateful to another from whom timely help was received; cast dirt into the well that given you water; to be an ingrate; ಉಂಡರೆ ಉಬ್ಬಸ, ಹಸಿದಿದ್ದರೆ ಸಂಕಟ uṇḍare ubbasa, hasididdare saŋkaṭa (prov.) one's bodily nature to be too delicate (in respect of health); ಉಂಡವನು ಬಲ್ಲನೆ ಉಣದವನ ಬವಣೆಯ uṇḍavanu ballane uṇadavana bavaṇeya (prov.) he who is full, takes no care for him that is fasting; ಉಂಡವನಿಗೆ ಊಟ(ಕ್ಕಿಕ್ಕ) ಬೇಡ, ಗುಂಡುಕಲ್ಲಿಗೆ ಎಣ್ಣೆ (ಒತ್ತ) ಬೇಡ uṇḍavanige ūṭa(kkikka) bēḍa. guṇḍukallige eṇṇe (otta)bēḍa (prov.) the belly that is full may well fast; he sups ill, who eats up all at dinner; ಉಂಡೆಯೇನೋ ಗುಂಡ ಎಂದರೆ, ಮುಂಡಾಸು ಮೂವತ್ತು ಮೊಳ ಅಂದ uṇḍeyēnō guṇḍa endare, muṇḍāsu mūvattu moḷa anda (prov.) to talk or answer without any connection with a given matter; 'I ask for a fork and you bring me a rake'; ಉಂಬೋಕೆ ಉಡೋಕೆ ಅಣ್ಣಪ್ಪ, ಕೆಲಸಕ್ಕೆ ಮಾತ್ರ ದೊಣ್ಣಪ್ಪ umbōke uḍōke aṇṇappa, kelasakke mātra doṇṇappa (prov.) while one toils, another takes the benefits; asses carry the oats, and horses eat them; ಉಣ್ಣಕ್ಕೆ ಇಕ್ಕಿದ ಕೈಯನ್ನು ಕಚ್ಚು uṇṇkke ikkida kaiyannu kaccu (prov.) to be or become, an ingrate; ಅದೇ ಉಂಡೇನು ಕದ ತೆಗಿ adē uṇḍēnu kada tegi (prov.) I will compromise when inevitable'; ಮಾಡಿದ್ದು ಉಣ್ಣೋ ಮಹಾರಾಯ māḍiddu uṇṇō mahārāya (prov.) to accept the consequences of one's actions, however unpleasant they are; to face the music.
wool - a) the soft, curly or crisped hair of sheep; b) the hair of some other animals, as goat or llama, having a similar texture.
wool from shredded rags; reprocessed wool.
a rough cloth made from this.
the god of food.
the act or an instance of having one's meal; taking a meal.
to cause to give out (splendour, talent, skill, etc.).
to cause to manifest.
to come out; to send out; to ooze out.
(one's skill, talent or ability) to become known to others.
to expand; to be blown up.
to be born.
to be radiant as with joy; to be beaming.
to happen; to occur; to befall.
existence - a) the state or fact of being; b) continuance of being; life; living.
that is made into a fabric (by interlacing threads or yarns); woven; knit.
a basket-like apparatus for blowing the chaff from grains by wind or forced current of air; a winnow-basket.
a variety in jowar (Sorghum Vulgare = Andropogon sorghum var. of Poacae family).
a document issued by the revenue department of a government, stating the source of water for a particular piece of agricultural land.
a discount - a) a reduction from a usual or list price; b) a deduction from a debt, allowed for paying promptly or in cash.
the interest deducted in advance by one who buys or lends money on, a bill of exchange, promissory note, etc.
the rate of interest charged for discounting a bill, note, etc.
to make a copy of (a written or printed matter); to copy.
slope - a) a piece of ground that is not flat or level; falling ground; b) any inclined line, surface, position, etc.; slant.
a going or coming down.
a declining or becoming less, smaller, etc.
a thing made just like another (chiefly written or printed matter); imitation of an original; full reproduction or transcription; a copy.
a reduction in price (usu. to promote more sales).
(dial.) an increase in or more than normal, yield from farming.
in book-keeping, the figure, usu. the cumulative total, carried over to the next page.
ಉತಾರು ಹಾಕು utāru hāku to deduct from the payment to be made to another; 2. to reduce in selling price (to promote sales); to discount.
acting or done suddenly with little thought; rash; impulsive; impetuous.
= ಉತಾವಳಿತನ.
the quality or fact of being rash, impulsive or impetuous; impetuosity.
= ಉತಾವಳಿ1.
= ಉತಾವಳಿತನ.
a loud announcement; the act of so announcing.
a stupid fellow.
the act or process of producing; production.
that which is produced; a product.
a flying up; a jumping up.
something that portends an unfortunate event, calamity about to occur, as earthquake, meteor, etc.
full of, characterised by or showing zeal; ardently devoted to a purpose; fervent; enthusiastic.
desirous of; longing for.
the plant Echinops echinatus of Asteraceae; thistle.
having the neck uplifted.
vehemently zealous; ardently eager.
raised voice; loud voice.
the state of holding the neck upward; the act of holding so.
an instance of shouting aloud.
great anxiety or impetuosity.
having or showing anxiety; uneasy in mind; apprehensive; worried; anxious.
feeling or showing keen desire; impatient or anxious to do or get; eager.
an anxious man.
he who is eager.
an anxious woman.
she who is eager.
excessive eagerness.
agony caused by separation of a beloved person.
she who has keen or strong eagerness.
the act or condition of quivering; tremor; tremble.
that is quivering or trembling.
having the hairs of head standing erect.
characterised by excess; being too much or too great; immoderate; excessive.
physically, morally or emotionally strong.
of a violently cruel nature; savage; wild; fierce.
having or showing great pride in oneself and disdain, contempt or scorn for others; proud; arrogant; supercilious; haughty.
giving cause for concern; dangerous; serious; grave.
outstandingly good of its kind; of exceptional merit, virtue, etc.; excellent.
excessiveness; abundance; plentifulness.
action or conduct that goes beyond the usual, reasonable or lawful limit.
the state or quality of being ferocious; dreadfulness; ferocity.
the yellowish-brown spice made from the dried inner bark of several trees or shrubs (Cinnamomum zeylanicum of Lauraceae family).
a very strong desire.
an afflicted condition; high degree of pain or suffering.
the quality of being excessive, abundant or plentiful.
the quality of going, acting beyond the usual, reasonable or lawful limit; the inclination of the mind to do so.
the quality or state of being dreadful, ferocious, dreadful or causing such a condition.
the condition or quality of being extremely difficult.
= ಉತ್ಕಟತೆ.
a state charged with excessiveness of character, feeling, momentum, desire, etc.
to have, driven by the impetus, strong desire, immoderate violence, etc.
a heap; a multitude; a pile.
the act of splitting.
the tree Anogeissus latifolia (=Conocarpus latifolia) of Combretaceae family; axle wood; (?).
the art of carving wood, chiselling stone, casting or welding metal, moulding clay or wax, etc. into three-dimensional representations, as statues, figures, forms, etc.; sculpture.
= ಉತ್ಕರ್ಷ.
a prosperous, successful man.
a man of eminence; a celebrity in a particular field.
superiority in rank, position, character, achievement, etc.; elevation; greatness; celebrity; eminence.
excellence; highest merit.
prosperous condition; good fortune, wealth, success, etc.; prosperity.
(in yogic exercises) a kind of controlled breathing.
= ಉತ್ಕರ್ಷಣಕಾರಿ1.
= ಉತ್ಕರ್ಷಣಕಾರಿ2.
that helps or causes (something) go up or prosper.
(said of chemicals) that increases the positive valence or decreases negative valence of an element.
that which helps or causes (another thing) go up, succeed or prosper.
(chem.) that helps combining with oxygen; that causes increase in the positive valence or decrease in the negative valence of an element or ion; an oxidiser.
= ಉತ್ಕರ್ಷಣ.
= ಉತ್ಕರ್ಷ.
the quality of being noble; nobility.
to cause to go up; to elevate.
to oxidise - a) to unite with oxygen, as in burning or rusting; b) to increase the positive valence or decrease the negative valence of (an element or ion).
a state in Eastern India, on the bay of Bengal; Orissa.
an inhabitant of this state.
a bird-catcher; a fowler.
one who caries load on his head or back, for others; an unskilled labourer; a porter; a coolie.
a door-keeper; a watchman.
a long stick (crooked or attached with a small brush, at one end) for sweeping and accumulating grains, pulses, in the threshing-area in a field.
a style of prose composition which abounds in complex sentences, long and hard compounds.
excessive eagerness.
a strong desire.
agony caused by separation of a beloved person.
she who has keen or strong eagerness.
a small swelling or projection on a plant, from which a shoot, cluster of leaves or flower develops; a bud.
sudden fear; fright.
a small water-vessel, with a nozzle for pouring out the water.
a bushy annual plant (Cicer arietinum) of the pea family, with short, hairy pods containing usually two seeds; the chickpea plant.
its seed ; chickpea.
any plant whose stem puts out tendrils or rootlets by which it can creep along a surface as it grows; a creeper.
a ridge or swell moving along the surface of a liquid or body of water as a result of disturbance, as by wind; a wave.
a large wave, caused by strong wind on the surface of the sea, that moves steadily without breaking.
= ಉತ್ಕಲ್ಲೋಲ.
the strong feeling of pain, and agony caused by the separation of a beloved person.
the elegance or beauty of flower buds in garden or open field; pulchritude of flowers.
the complex condition of having various subtle feelings of agony caused by separation from a beloved person.
= ಉತ್ಕಲಿಕೆ.
to put forth buds.
to aspire for greater achievements, heights.
an aspiration for higher achievements.
the act of blowing the chaff from grain by wind or a forced current of air; winnowing; winnow.
heaping up of grains.
heaped or piled up; stacked one above the other.
thrown up.
engraved; carved; sculptured.
to engrave - a) to cut or incise letters, designs, etc. in or on (a surface); b) to cut or incise (a picture, letters, etc.) into a metal plate, wooden block, etc. for printing.
to put into soil, esp. into the ground; to set firmly as into the ground; to plant.

any of various members of wingless, bloodsucking hemipteran insects of Cimicidae family, esp. of Cimex lectularius species with a broad, flat, reddish-brown body and an unpleasant odour that infests beds, furniture, walls, etc., is active mainly at night, and may transmit a variety of diseases; a bug.
any of small, flat, wingless insects of Anoplura order with sucking mouthparts, parasitic on the hair of humans and some other mammals; a louse.
the crest or summit of a very high hill or mountain ending in a point.
a shade, usually of cloth stretched over a folding radial frame, carried for protection against the rain or sun; an umbrella.
a metre having four lines of twenty six syllables each.
drawn up or out.
excelling another or others in quality or merit; excellent; exquisite.
a drawing back of the string of a bow before shooting an arrow.
the state or quality of being superior or higher, greater, better, etc; superiority; surpassing goodness; excellence.
the state of holding the neck upward; the act of holding so.
an instance of shouting aloud.
great anxiety or impetuosity.
an anxious woman.
she who is eager (to meet her lover).
an apparent, but not real centre of a circle.
the state, quality or amount of being eccentric; eccentricity.
the ratio of the distances from any point of a conic section to the focus and to the directrix.
not having the same centre, as two circles one inside the other; going away from the centre; eccentric.
not having the axis exactly in the centre; off-centre.
the distance between the centre of a shaft and the centre of its eccentric wheel; eccentricity.
a banner held high or flying high.
a bending upwards.
diffusion of thing pervading the space above.
an act of making another deviate from the right path; anything, esp. money, given or promised to induce a person to do something illegal or wrong; a bribe.
the quality of being not straightforward or dishonest, crookedness; dishonesty.
a shouting aloud.
a person who is influenced by bribing or who accepts bribes for favouring illegally another .
the act of going up; a moving in the space above; progressive increase.
a wrong, illegal, extreme action or behaviour; a going astray.
the act of going up or moving in the sky; ascent.
a going to the region above; departure from this world; the flight of the soul; an instance of dying.
a grade order or class of a body of people, animals or things ranked one above the other, with respect to authority or dominance, esp. in logical and scientific classifications.
to go up; to step up; to ascend.
to step beyond; to transgress; to violate.
to step out of this world; to pass away; to die.
a going up or out; departure.
the flight of the soul out of the body; death.
(Dvaita phil.) the departure of the soul from the body through a particular passage called ಬ್ರಹ್ಮನಾಡಿ.
process of development, as from a simple to a complex form or of gradual, progressive change, as in a social and economic structure; evolution.
(in yogic exercises) a kind of controlled breathing.

the process or theory of evolution - a) the gradual cumulative change in the characteristics of organisms over many generations, which results in new species; b) any development from a simpler to a more complex or advanced form.
a loud outcry; uproar; clamour.
a vehement, continued expression of the general feeling or of public opinion; loud demand or complaint.
a large, black-and-white diving bird of prey of Pandionidae family, (Pandion haliaetus species), which feeds mainly on fish; osprey.

any of piciform birds of Picidae family, distinguished by stiff tail feathers used for support, a strong, pointed, chisel-shaped bill used for drilling holes in bark to get insects, and a long, protrusile tongue with a spearlike tip; woodpecker.
thrown up; projected upwards; tossed.
held up; placed high.
(dance) a lifting of the head with the face-looking at the sky as if look a thing moving in the sky or to indicate permission to take, go, jump up or fly away etc.
the act of throwing upwards; projection upwards by force.
one who or that which throws or tosses up.
he who or that which elevates or raises.
he who steals; a thief.
a suspended block for finding the velocity of projectiles; ballistic pendulum.
a measuring of or the process of measuring, the velocity or projectiles.
the science dealing with the motion and impact of projectiles, such as bullets, rockets, bombs, etc.; ballistics.
excavation - a) an excavating or being excavated; b) a hole, depression, ditch or hollow made by excavating.
a man who excavates; an excavator.
(root) taken out from the ground; uprooted.
dug or turned out; excavated.
drawn or pulled out from deep inside.
eradicated or annihilated (completely).
an excavated place.
something unearthed by excavating; that which is got or recovered from excavation.
(psych.) the process of bringing one's repressed emotions and memories to the conscious level and free expression of the same; abreaction.
a place or region which is neither too far nor too close; (literarally, in between those can be referred to with 'there' and 'here').
p.p. of the verb 'ಉಱು' (to be).
p.p. of the verb 'ಉರು' (to till, plough).
(coming, going) towards the central region, portion.
a golden necklace worn by women.
held up; supported (from below).
an ornament, chaplet, a wreath etc., worn on the crown of the head.
an ear-ring; an ornament for the ear.
(fig.) the best or most excellent man (among).
the most excellent man.
furnished with ornaments; ornamented; decorated.
(fig.) exhibiting brilliant character or behaviour.
= ಉತ್ತ1.
the sweet, fleshy fruit of the date palm (Phoenis dactylifera of Arecaceae family), having a large, hard seed; date.
the tree itself.
heated; characterised by a relatively or abnormally high temperature; hot.
a kind of swollen cake made of rice etc.
